Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: raymond b
Reviews.Content: Had A Great Timeeven know The PoolWas closed IT didn't matter when the ocean is right There. They Gave Us A Discount ON Our Room Because OF The Pool. They ALL Were Very Nice People WE Were ON The Bottom Floor Near THE Bar And AT night You Don't Hear The Noise Over There. WE Were There From 7/8/12-7/16/12.... WE Had A Great Stay WE Will BE Back There Same Time Next year Thank You Roomba Inn For A Great Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the roomba, go all summer long, get the hotel on the beach.,”
Reviews.Author: Jellybellydrake
Reviews.Content: The beach is 10 foot away and wonderful The pool is stunning...it's older and a beat down some but when you can open your front door and walk out on the beach..try that at the Hilton, that's like staying at the mall not a beach..,it's amazing'!!'

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Smile2006
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to spend a night in Daytona Beach while driving down the strip we were looking for something close to the pier, we had use our GPS and decided on two hotels to stop into, while driving by we saw the Roomba and decided to check out the rates after a brief search through the reviews. This hotel is a diamond in the rough but your expectactiona should be in check. This is not the Hilton, it never pretends to be....but if you want something close to the pier and all the stores that's on the beach for a reasonable price this is for you! We got a courtyard view buy were lucky to have an ocean view from our room. Request room 201 or 202 and you will have the same luck we did :) Overall we will be back, the service and attentiveness of the front desk staff was amazing. Quick check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Blessed by a last minute blunder!!”
Reviews.Author: MilagrosMartinez
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the newly remodeled Roomba Inn due to another hotel in Daytona never processed or reserved us a room. Blunder or more like a Blessing! The Roomba Inn is close to all the fun areas in Daytona Beach. You are a 2 minute walk from the great bar and grill “Ocean Deck “and close to the “Boardwalk Pier”. Frances at their front desk is a GEM!!! She was very helpful, personable and went out of her way to make us comfortable in the middle of the night. She exemplifies what good customer service should be. The rooms have microwave, mini fridge and coffee makers at no extra cost.This is not a resort hotel, but if you are looking for a decently clean, well located and cost effective place to stay, this is your best option in Daytona Beach. I have seen and stayed at plenty hotels by the beach, and this has been by far the best experience we’ve had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: globe88
Reviews.Content: cheap rooms for $69 with nice beach view! great location nice city. I'll come back again!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS.....”
Reviews.Author: jessd2012
Reviews.Content: wow this place was horrible... front desk staff was rude,,, rooms was gross... bed ahd bugs.. and termite bodys everywhere.. i dont know how the ocean deck doesnt have termites because their right next door... this place is not american owned and it showed... stay any where else trust me... you will get a better deal and ac that works in anyother hotel.... stay away from the roomba

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough!! MUST GO!!”
Reviews.Author: frankie_rosa
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay some place near DaytonaLagoon so my husband found The roomba Inn & Suites. I am kinda anal about where I sleep, so I wanted to read the reviews about this place. Boy was I surprised to read those review, so you know I was skeptic, but we decided to stay anyways. This place was nice, as we came in, front desk was very friendly, even gave us a welcome package & the prices were cheaper than most, so we stayed here. I was a bit discouraged because I expected a pool, but the pool is being renovated as I type. They are to have a new heated pool & a new pool deck in two weeks or so they said. To make it better they discounted our rate & offered me a 15% off my next visit, something like a loyalty discount I think they said. The room (213) they said it was bigger then most of the other rooms & it was pretty big. The room was kinda stuffy, but nice. The bathroom was quite uninviting maybe if they had whiter towels & a better paint job it would be better , the walls need re caulking, patching, & painting, the electrical outlet needed replacing, & the room in general could use a new face lift. The hotel really needs work. NOW HERE'S THE BEST PART: Our room was an oceanview room with a balcony. It was a really hot morning so we were sitting outside watching the sunrise must say it was so amazing! We even saw some dolphines can you believe it? The seanery alone is worth staying here, at breakfast they had bagels, muffins, danishes, pop tarts, oatmeal, fruit cups, & coffee, apple, & orange juice. I would of expected a bit more or different. As we checked out I over heard the staff talking about a new change they are planning to do to inprove the hotel. They spoke of possibly renovating the front desk lobby & each room one by one and also possibly offering turn down service & front door service so that the guest don't need to keep comming to the front desk & they feel a little more like home. We deffinatly will come back again to see if the change was made. I loved it here!! & you should at least try it for yourself. It is worth it & you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “ONCE A NICE PLACE!!!! NOW NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: SRM_12
Reviews.Content: never had a proble when it was a super 8. new OWNERS NEW PROBLEMS!!!!!!!!!beware BEWARE BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I have stayed at this hotel 2 or 3 times a year for the last 4 years. Minumum stay 2 night each visit. I have never had any issues with my credit card, EVER.I stayed april 2012 for 2 night. My card was charged. I get a call a few day after checkout explaining that my card was not charged. long long story short.....after speaking to a MANAGER i was assured that this was taken care of. she spoke to my credit card company and faxed. today i get a call from A MANGER explaining that my card was not charged. i spoke once again to my credit card company. . i called with a conference call my credit card company stated for the 5th time, THEY WERE paid for my stay on 4/30/12. i will never stay at your hotel again. i have given you countless numbers of clients. from a few MC'c from NY that come down for bike week. doctors and nurses from jacksonville and sandfors peds hospital. not including traveling family members and frineds. I will need to place a negative on any review site that i see. After all of this do you think i would get an apology or a nights comp. I will never ever stay at your hotel. i will make sure everyone knows what type of shady people you are. If it was just a computer issue i could understand. But 2 months after my stay you attempt to charge another $222 on june 12th!!!!!!!!!! i use to really enjoy staying at this hotel when it was a super 8

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bward27
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else but here! Its rundown overpriced and the staff steals!!! We got our room broken into by their security! Who they fired that day! The hotel personnel made it clear they had no insurance and would do nothing to compensate us for our 2100 dollar loss after we had the whole cheer team taking up 10 rooms for a week! Unfortunately we have to involve a lawyer. I will actively try to get this hotel shutdown! DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here unless you want your car towed!”
Reviews.Author: jeanilb1
Reviews.Content: Our vehicle was towed within fifteen minutes of checking in. The hotel has an "agreement" with a local towing company, allowing them to tow vehicles without checking to find out if they belong to registered guests. We were given a parking pass to put in our car but it was raining so we went to our room to put a few things away, and when we came out within minutes our car was gone! We spent the rest of the evening until 1 a.m. dealing with the fiasco and trying to get our car back from the towing company. The employees told us this happens all the time, and even the employee's have had their cars towed. The manager refused to refund our first night's room charge, and said it wasn't "their fault", although anyone with any sense knows tow companies can not legally enter private property and tow vehicles without authorization. It appears the managment may get kickbacks.

Reviews.Title: “New owner!! New hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliejackson2204
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel every feb-mar for the last 5 years. Before it was the cheapest place on the beach with a great location but overall needed a lot of work!! This year we came and was COMPLETELY surprised!! New beds new carpets new refrigerator and no issue with plumbing like we have had every year!! The room didn't smell and it was clean!!! 100% better than last year and I'm proud to say we will continue our tradition with Roomba Inn!! Love it and keep up the good work!!! Mrs Jackson (Indiana)

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't expecting 4 stars but wasn't expecting this either...”
Reviews.Author: coconutace
Reviews.Content: Like the review before I booked this hotel months in advance for the Daytona 500 when it was the Super 8 and did not get informed that it had been sold to Roomba. We found out about 2 weeks before our vacation and called to make sure they still had our reservation which they did but at a higher rate saying that's the rate Super 8 gave them when they transferred all the info. After talking to the manager the rate was fixed but our room was downgraded to no kitchen. At that point we were just happy to have a reservation because as we checked in there were people that had booked through priceline that did not have reservations anymore. We knew that the quality of the hotel/rooms left a lot to be desired based on previous reviews and being there for the race we knew we were overpaying ($180 a night). Pros: -Motel is oceanfront in the area of the beach where cars are not allowed so we were in a prime location. Nearby shopping, restaurants etc. -Free Continental breakfast included bagels, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee and muffins and was restocked frequently. Cons: -Motel is next door to a bar/club that hosts a live band on the beach that plays until 12am. The music was so loud that even with earplugs (for the race) we were still unable to sleep. At 12am the party moved indoors and we thought we would be able to sleep... NOPE then the dj started and it was just as loud Friday/Saturday until almost 2am. -Customer service from the front desk was non existent with the night crew The second day of our stay when we returned to the hotel at night our front door was open. We went to the front desk to let them know that perhaps the maid had not closed it all the way and his response was "What do you want me to do?"... so at that point we told him we'd rather not have housekeeping enter the room if they couldn't be trusted with closing the door. We also had an issue with the toilet clogging and called the front desk. They didn't have anyone available to come up to the room right away and we were heading out for dinner and since we didn't trust the staff to enter the room while we were out we asked if we could just borrow a plunger. Simple request... The front desk had to call the manager because he didn't know where a plunger was, then call again and ask if it was ok for us to use the plunger, then he wanted us to come to the front desk to pick up the plunger. Geez we are willing to do the maintenance man's job the least he could do was bring the plunger to us. -The pool was out of order. I understand that in Feb. perhaps the pool usually doesn't get much use but the weather 10 days ahead of our arrival had Daytona Beach at 85 degrees. Knowing you have a full house for a special event perhaps you could get one of the few amenities you have to offer working. It looked like it was being filled but our 4 days there it never filled. Bottom line is we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kat M
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend told me about a great cheap hotel right on Daytona Beach that he loved, I was skeptical. Seems like you need to pick a big name to feel secure in what you're getting these days. I have to say, he was completely right! The very friendly, knowledgeable woman at the front desk put us in a king room with an ocean view and a private balcony on the second floor. The view was gorgeous, the room was clean and comfortable, the pool was clear and sparkling, and it really was RIGHT on the beach! (I rested after some shopping and it was so relaxing just listening to the ocean with the balcony door open.) We could walk to the boardwalk, restaurants, and shops right from it. And the rate was very reasonable - the lowest I paid on our trip around Florida and my favorite hotel by far. I think some of the existing reviews here are from when it was a Super 8 (pre-September 2011), so I wanted to put something up here that's current. It wasn't musty, noisy, or dirty in the least. It really was a find!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Leanne H
Reviews.Content: We stay here in late sept as a family of 6 from Australia. We only booked for 1 night as we were traveling around but ended up staying 3 nights. We love it. It was clean staff was friendly and helpful and its handy 2 everything. We parked the car up n walked everywhere. We are even planning of coming back in Feb 2013. We stayed in bottom rooms next 2 the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 DB Oceanfront is now Roomba Inn and a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Phykos
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stayed here during a conference at the Ocean Center. This hotel was cheaper than the conference hotel, provided free parking, free wireless and free breakfast--sold! There is a musty smell to the rooms, but come on people, its ON the beach and the beach is wet. The A/C worked fine to take some of the humidity out of the room and we had an oceanfront efficiency so we could open the door to the ocean and the front door to get a nice cross breeze going. The room had a full size refrigerator with freezer, a microwave, sink and efficiency oven/stove. There was a lone pot in the cabinets so we assumed we would have to ask at the front desk for the dishes, etc. but considering we didn't plan on cooking, we didn't ask. There was a small table and two chairs in our two double bed room. We had ample towels and when additional were requested, they were quickly delivered by Stephanie. The front desk was helpful (although clueless at times). The breakfast was coffee, apple or orange juice, hot water for oatmeal, bagels with cream cheese, butter or jelly, muffins, danishes, oranges, individual servings of cereal. All pretty standard continental breakfast fare. We did have to go to the front desk twice to get our cards re-magnetized. No idea what happen but the staff quickly fixed the cards so no complaints there. All-in-all, this is a cheap hotel with cheap prices. Shop around and if Roomba Inn is the cheapest, don't hesitate to try them out!

Reviews.Title: “Well it is on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Iamjim1953
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before I went, so I can not complain too much. Yes the rain comes into the room. Yes, there is a mold smell, Yes, they had no shampoo for a couple of days, Yes, they did not give us towels one day, Yes, the maintenance guy was working on the balcony door started Tuesday and did not finish before we left Saturday. The door was being held on by one hinge. The "breakfast" was either donuts, bagels or dry cereals. That is if you got there early. This was Biketoberfest week and they decided to seal the parking lot and stripe. But it is on the beach, and the 75.00 per night room was bearable for the first few days, but then it change to 179.00 a night. The room did not get cleaner, smell less, or the door get fixed, etc. The people were nice, but could not fix the problems. I was with 3 other couples and they had the same problems as I, except for the door.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: coachklein
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was very dirty and had an unpleasent odor. The staff was rude and not helpfull. We checked out and found other accomidations.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: RPDEAP
Reviews.Content: The 72-hr. cancellation policy should have been the first red flag... We booked based upon an ad in the Daytona Beach Visitor's Guide; the photos looked so clean and pretty, it looked brand new! Pros: Great beach, fireworks at the Pier on Sat night were great, friendly staff although semi-inept at times. CONS: Lobby smelled like urine/nursing home (but no bathrooms in sight ?), parking area is terrible, no elevator, shaky railings on stairs, peeling paint everywhere, dirty doors, the ONE ice machine found was slow, pool cloudy-looking, no closet area in room to hang clothing (? - that was a first!), red stains on carpeting and wall (blood? ketchup?), bedspread cover had a stain on the underside, A/C unit cover falling off, two bugs found in room, porch railing paint was peeling and rusting, plastic chairs on porch were dirty, CARPETING WAS FILTHY...I had shoes on all day (on clean feet!); took off shoes once in the room, walked from the balcony door to the bathroom, got into the shower and noticed black footprints in the tub...MINE. It so grossed me out that I had been walking on that carpet and made me wonder what sort of foot diseases I would get. I barely slept that night wondering if more bugs were somewhere in the room or if there were bed bugs, even though the sheets did appear clean...pillows were dense and not comfortable at all. I still get terrible goose bumps thinking about this room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: traelee
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Super 8 over the Memorial Day weekend. It wasn't our idea, as our trip was planned around our son's tournament. I was very reluctant to stay at this property and finally decided to call the front desk. The woman was very pleasant and helpful, so I added that I needed to be on the first floor. Checkin was quick and easy. The women up front all seemed quite knowledgeable. I booked an oceanfront room w/ a full kitchen area and 2 double beds (the nonsmoking jacuzzi suite was booked already and is located on the 2nd floor). Our room cost an additional $20+ per night compared to a standard room, but the kitchen and ocean were worth it. We stayed in the bottom corner room (113, I believe). I had low expectations and had packed air fresheners, santizers, etc. I was surprised to find that I didn't really need any of it. The a/c worked really well, the room was far more spacious than others. We drove to Walmart and bought a twin sized cot for my son to use. There was room for 3 or 4 of those. The kitchen area looked adequate, but we never used it. The fridge was full sized and really old, but it kept our drinks cold and ice frozen. The bathroom was quite clean, althouogh it could use updating. I was paranoid and looked for bugs the entire time. The only encounter we had was w/ a fly that was briefly in our room and possibly some spider webs in the hallway, but I didn't actually see anything that bothered me. The absolute best part was through the back door--the ocean was fantastic. We had a concrete area where we could leave our boogie boards, folding chairs, and shoes, which was convenient. At night, I slept in the bed next to the door and would just smile b/c I could hear the waves crashing. We rarely heard any other guests b/c the room is somewhat isolated. Housekeeping came daily and took care of all the sand we tracked in (despite putting towels down). Our friends enjoyed the pool area quite a bit, but it wasn't large and the chairs go fast. With the ocean 200 ft away, it seemed silly to sit there anyway. My hubby delivered a bagel w/ cream cheese and drinks to me each morning, so I suppose the 'free' breakfast was adequate. There was a 'room service' menu in the room and the prices looked decent. I don't think it was made on premesis, but was delivered from elsewhere. Since we were able to walk to so many restaurants, I never used the option, but it was nice to see it was available. The parking lot was tight, but somehow it worked out fine. And it was free, which wasn't true of the other hotels/motels nearby. I would certainly return based on this experience. I'm sure our stay was more pleasant than what others encounter at different times or in different rooms. We were so happy with the staff and were greeted by everyone, even the maintainence guys. The staff really seemed to care about the property. Our final night in Daytona was booked down the road at the Hilton in a cabana suite. It was a major mistake. It was crowded and awful. We spent the whole time in lines waiting for a room or for the valet. What a waste of nearly $400! My family was stressed and angry at me b/c we all missed the Super 8!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: halugalaw
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most awful hotels I have ever stayed at. Upon arrival there were bugs all over the room and bug excrement all over the sheets. Anticipating that Super8 would not follow through on their advertisements regarding cleanliness, I brought my own linens and had to use them (though I still could not sleep in fear of having bugs crawling all over me). The phone did not have half the buttons on it and the room smelled. The parking lot was the most frustrating driving experience ever and we chose to park up front and walk because it was so bad, AND OUR CAR IS SMALL. We actually left the hotel early after a roach crawled across my pillow. When I called the front desk (upon returning to my home and washing all of the hotel nastiness off) to report the multiple problems we encountered and I was met with absolute disinterest. I will never stay at this hotel again, EVER, nor will I stay at any Super8. I gave the company a chance and was shocked with the nightmare that it turned out to be. Oh, and this was a mini vacation we took to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday, which was totally ruined by this disgusting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bargain on the beach”
Reviews.Author: thehankster
Reviews.Content: Went to Daytona for an impromptu spring break weekend, and everything else on the beach was full by the time I got around to booking. This turned out to be a stroke of luck, because this place has an incredible location and is really a remarkable value. Things did not start well. Check-in could only be described as nightmarish. Their computers had gone down, and my reservation wasn't on the printed list they had. Thankfully I was able to pull up my confirmation and receipt on my phone and show it to the front desk staff, or I might still be waiting for my room. The woman at the front desk was very nice and apologetic for the inconvenience, but even after I showed her the aforementioned documentation on my phone she seemed to have no plan to get me into my room and made me wait while she checked in several other guests who arrived after me. Finally, after I had waited in the lobby for at least 45 minutes -- this is no exaggeration, and it may actually have been over an hour -- a man who worked there took down the information from my phone and got me checked in. I really felt sorry for them because I understand they were in a difficult position with a fully-booked hotel and my reservation not being on the list, but after the first half hour of waiting I admit I felt even sorrier for myself. That was, however, the only blemish on an otherwise great stay. First, this property has to have the best location of any Super 8 anywhere. It's right on the beach, and the view from our room -- and from our balcony overlooking said beach -- was amazing. If you want to enjoy a beach vacation in Daytona, there is really no reason to pay more, especially considering that if you stay in one of the more expensive high rise hotels on the beach it would actually take you a lot longer to walk from your room to the sand. The hotel is right next to what turned out to be my favorite bar/club in town, also right on the beach, and a variety of restaurants, bars, shops, etc. are within walking distance. Really can't say enough about the location -- just shockingly great. The room itself was basic but spacious enough, and very clean. There's a range, sink, counter space and a fridge if you're inclined to cook for yourself. We were not so inclined, but there was enough room on the counter to hold boxes of pizza and enough room in the fridge to hold plenty of beer. They also serve coffee in the lobby in the morning, and it was really quite good. A/C worked perfectly. Parking was free but tight because the place was packed with spring breakers -- kids these days need to learn to carpool -- but we got a space right down the stairs from our room, so that was also very convenient. We didn't use the pool, but the pool area looked clean and pleasant. This was spring break, after all, so the whole town had a bit of a loud party atmosphere, but we had no trouble sleeping. There were quite a few college kids at the hotel, but there were also families with kids, and it seemed like a perfect place for either demographic. And yes, it's a Super 8 and correspondingly no-frills, but I would even recommend it for a romantic getaway -- after all the only thing more romantic than a great location on the beach is saving money on a great location on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, although in need of a spruce up”
Reviews.Author: Jessy4Paws
Reviews.Content: The views from the beachfront rooms are just beautiful, could not be better. What a truly lovely beach. The room seemed clean enough and the staff were pleasant but the fridge and cooker in the room were very rusty and the pillows were flat as pancakes. Told reception about the pillows and they said they would get some more, if they do the room will be a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Service in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: jtiii3
Reviews.Content: We were traveling from London and landed in Jacksonville, FL. Our kids wanted to see the ocean so we decided to stop in Daytona Beach. We stopped at the Super 8 on the beach. The price was affordable, but the service we received, I did not expect for an economy hotel. We were greeted with smiles from ear to ear and I love how they ended everything with Super. This is an exterior hotel and we did noticed some construction going on at the property while we were there. I am glad to see they are trying to improve their property because it is needed, but it was clean and comfortable. What they have there is what is lacking at a lot of service establishments and that is customer service. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: SlowCalaNative
Reviews.Content: 133 South Ocean Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118 Pros: Friendly staff,clean sheets.AC worked,fridge and microwave and on the beach. Cons:Very tiny room,parking small and spaces are very, very close together,dirty carpets,less than par TV,toilet overflowed.weak water pressure,outside and inside falling apart and pool water was green. This should be a $30.00 room year round.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: underdogrides
Reviews.Content: I stayed several nights at this hotel while I was in town for a Volkswagen car show. The best thing about this place is the location. It is within walking distance of many of the places you would want to see, the pier, the drive-on beach, main street, shops, restaurants etc. The room that I had was on the second floor overlooking the beach. I found the room to be clean and ready when I checked in. Some reviewers have complained about dirty rooms and roaches, but I found nothing of the sort while I was there. There was free high speed Internet in the room, the refrigerator was adequate and the bed was comfortable. Now remember, this is not a five-star hotel so don't expect the amenities you would find in one. However, there were plenty of the things you expect in any hotel. There were plenty of towels, a coffee maker and television. The free breakfast was good, nothing fancy but the food, juices and coffee were fresh and tasty. The ocean view from my room was spectacular. The sunrise was magnificent. There is free parking, the staff was okay and overall, not a bad experience for the money. You could pay more than double and stay at the Hilton up the street (I have during another trip) and pay exorbitant fees for parking ($19 a day) and for Internet ($9 per day). Both are free here. This place is certainly not the Hilton, but for what it cost, it is more than adequate. Don't come here expecting a plush beachfront resort. If you do, you will be disappointed. If you come to sleep in a safe clean place, this is a good choice. When I travel, I do not stay in the room much, except for sleep, so for my purpose, this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Dump! Has not been maintained but has a great view and good location!”
Reviews.Author: mendihas3
Reviews.Content: This place has not been maintained at all. I read the reviews and knew what to expect. However, I know how picky some people can be...it was worse than I expected! If you are expecting a full kitchen with silverware-don't! There is NO dishwasher either. Also, the rooms are small!

Reviews.Title: “If you're not picky, this place is for you!”
Reviews.Author: mols2006
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was nervous about this place but after visisting I think some people are just hard to please. Stayed for 6 nights and it definitely was nothing fancy, but the staff was ALWAYS helpful and super friendly, and the oceanfront location was beautiful. Continental breakfast was also nothing fancy but free food is free food. Bottom line, this place was around $50/night so I wasn't expecting 5 stars. The rooms was adequate and clean which was the most important. GREAT POOL! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't so bad..”
Reviews.Author: lovebugto
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, and well kept. The parking was hard espically on Sat. night or if you have a big car or van. but found you could walk to most anything you wanted. The big down fall for us seemed to be sea turtle season. the hotel is not aloud lights on the beach side. so there were no lights in or around the pool at night and my ocean view balconey had a light but it could not be turned on. Cont, breakfast was ok but dont be late they shut it down right at 9 am.

Reviews.Title: “Motel from HELL is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: rayndropzz
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at aprox. 9:00 pm on Fri. April 16th 2010, I knew I had made a BIG mistake on my choice of motels. Lets just say that there was no parking available, so if you can't park you can't check- in, right??? After driving around for about 30 mins. I finally got a parking spot, (that was after I had to ask the taxi driver if he could move his vehicle so I could park) you see, they have a line of about 10 taxis sitting out in front of this dump, covering any available parking spots. Park the car, go to check in and the ofc. is locked, you have to check-in through a bullet proof window with a tiny little opening in the bottom. The man that checked us in was pleasant enough. There was 3 families, myself include that was checking in (we were together) Had to sign a check-in sheet that requires all the usual info, name address, tag # etc. I was told not to worry about it just sign and give a copy of DL. Finally done with that and of to our rms we all went. Opened my door and thats when the SMELL about knocked me over, damp, musky, moldy, mildew. I went back to the ofc. to see if they had any other rms available as I didn't think that it would be to healthy to be there, but they didn't so I asked for some air freshener, hoping that would do the job, they gave it to me without a problem. Back to the room I go, opened up the door, sprayed the room and sat outside for about an hour. I wasn't the only one with the same prob. people I was with had nasty smelly rooms also. Anyways, finally went back in, thought all would be well, but then it got worse......... Flushed the toilet and the gates of hell opened up !!! now i'm back at the ofc. again, this time they send a young guy over with a plunger to try and fix it, he tried for about an hour and couldn't get it to work. After repeated calls to the ofc. from the employee to try and get me some help, they finallly got it working. By this time it is almost midnight, we where for a cheerleading competion the following day, and that left us with 5 hours to get some sleep. Sleep didn't happen there....... Walls are paper thin, could hear tv's from both sides, people outside arguing etc. ofc. was of no help. Dealt with it til We checked-out at 6:30. I'm done, but the saga continues. My friend that I checked in with had an even bigger issue !!! they had her car towed because they did not see her parking placard, $165 later, she got her car back and to the amazement of all, there was her parking slip on the floor, it had fallen of the mirror. Did they do anything for her ??? that would be a big "NO" lets just say if they had done the job right in the first place they would have had her tag # etc. So to any and all that plan on going there "BEWARE" it will be your worse nightmare, Sorry to make this so long but had to let people know. Thanks for listening

Reviews.Title: “Supper Smell Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandScottish
Reviews.Content: The room (109) was smelly, it was making us sick. The carpet was dirty, seemed damp and sticky. The toiled run water constantly. There was no extractor fan in the bathroom, small window which would not open. The sink tap was loose, could not run the water. This hotel needs to have a health and safety inspection asap. Regret that did not read reports before paying for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Motel from hell”
Reviews.Author: appytyme
Reviews.Content: Fights all night long on night of march 12,2010, in room next to us, broken windows next door then in our room window broken by rowdy drunk female walking by our room, very rowdy spring break crowd totally out of control,even management reluctant to adjust our room,we stayed here before with no problems ,we are very very disappointed never again will we stay there. avoid spring break at all cost .this truly is a MOTEL FROM HELL

Reviews.Title: “Worn out”
Reviews.Author: NorwayRobert
Reviews.Content: I have been here before. I would say that the people that works here are ok, but the rooms are not. Everything in the room has to be a least 20 years old. I belive they are doing their best, but I will not come back. It's all falling apart. I also found a new friend -in my shoe! Trow out all the old stuff. Get new doors. Clean up and repaint the whole place. Then I'll be back. The location is good, but thats all. Sorry folks. Robert, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down, The Most Disgusting Hotel I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler190
Reviews.Content: I traveled there with 3 other guys to the Daytona 500. My friend booked the room, and after reading the reviews, I was concerned. I called the manager, who told me the hotel was not new or fancy, but it was clean and efficient. Against better judgment, I pressed on. Very bad decision. Very bad. The first room, an upgraded ocean front "suite", was not reasonably habitable for humans. Rotten floor at balcony door, mold, very disgusting smell, stained bedspreads and blankets, stained, rotten carpet. We refused the room and were given two standard rooms. They were horrible. I'm not talking a little bad. I'm talking way, way bad. Like bug bite bad. We were left with absolutely no options as it was race weekend and everything was fully booked. Don't think for a minute I'm being the least bit picky. This is 4 guys at a car race, each of whom had the "all we need to do is crash" mentality. I assumed we could drink any room into acceptability. Wrong. Not possible at this filthy, disgusting place. We had reserved our rooms for Friday - Monday, but it was so bad, we left on Sunday, because none of us could stand another night in such conditions. We had to pay for both rooms for Sunday night and still elected to leave. It was so bad I agreed to stay out of the cooler at the Daytona 500 so I could drive us home. Do you get that? I watched all my buddies have cocktails while I stayed completely alcohol free at a NASCAR race, because I couldn't take the filth any longer. This is not just a bad value, or an unpleasant place to stay - IT SUCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, stay elsewhere......”
Reviews.Author: kirbey38
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through a well trusted discounted hotel supplier back in November for a couple of days during the Daytona 500. Most rooms in Daytona are all booked, but the few that were left were 2 star quality, but still charged 5 star prices because of the race. All well and good if it had been clean. The place is just gross! We have stayed at many 2 star quality hotels in the past, and even if things were dated, we have been pleased with the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff. Not here. Carpet filthy with stains, bedspread the same, pillows smelled of body odor,and a few German roaches, one tried crawling into the fridge when we opened it. They should be ashamed to charge what they did per night this past weekend. There are plenty of hotels for cheaper prices when there are not events going on, we have stayed at quite a few, and have never been as disappointed as we were this past weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms - not good value for money - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dawn O
Reviews.Content: Well, in all honesty, the only thing I think you are paying for here is the ocean front option, I was a bit shocked when I walked into my room , it was just so dirty looking, very dated and shabby. I fell out with my friend while holidaying in Orlando so for some "me time" I came here on a greyhound bus! To be honest it was a good job I was so excited about travelling on my own....Thank God I was only staying one night though! There was a fridge, A TV, microwave, A GIANT COCKROACH which I could not for the life of me catch under the ice bucket. The bedding was clean I hope, but no, it wasnt up to my average expectations really, wont recommend OR stay again. Next time pay extra and get something clean. On the up side, the staff couldn't do enough for me. They let me check in early and called me a taxi, even called to chase up the taxi when it was late, really good, Didnt even get charged for the safe I used. Also, if the hotel was to a higher standard they would really make some $$$ from these rooms, mine opened out onto some steps which led onto the beach! Shame. There are budget hotels, I understand that, I stayed in one in Orlando, but this wasn't a patch on it. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Motorcycle Gang Fight Did Not Help”
Reviews.Author: eggbert_tg
Reviews.Content: This place is a DIVE. The location is good; everything else is about as bad as they get. A motorcycle gang showed up during our stay, got drunk someplace, then came back and had a great big argument & fight. None of this would have been so bad, except the WiFi absolutely would NOT work. I finally tapped into the WiFi for the restaurant next door, and was able to use this. This was our 2nd stay at this motel: I hope I never stay in this, or any other, Super 8 for as long as I live.

Reviews.Title: “Has it's Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Beach_Bum_6
Reviews.Content: We went over to the beach for two nights the end of September for my Birthday and my grands. We stayed in an oceanfront room for 52 a night. The young lady cleaning the room and the front desk were very nice. This is not a 5 star place by any means but I did not expect it to be. You are 3 or 4 motels south of the pier which was nice. There are life guards on either side of the motel which was nice as well. I was pleased to find a small stove and full size frig in the room. I had expected a small frig and microwave. Both were very clean so was the bathroom. Someone posted that here are no lights on the ocean side of the motel. That is the law due to sea turtles. Nothing the motel can do to change that. The WiFI worked great for us. You do need a code from the front desk to use it. And as far as breakfast... nothing to brag about but was not as bad as some. They do freeze there bagels and muffins. On the negative side.... There was so much clorine in the pool it burned your eyes and stunk. We had to go and buy mask for the kids to swim. Second all along the sea wall were sandspears. Someone really needs to attend to them as they are growing up the cracks of the sea wall and all along one set of steps. I will stay again... however, if the pool is in the same shape the second time as it was the first I will not go back. We live in the pool when we are there

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES IN THE ROOM, TERRIBLE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: KristelMIami
Reviews.Content: Chose it because of location, it is oceanfront, but in the back no lights, you could not even enjoy the ocean front view at night because they have no light in the back. the place is run down, dirty carpet is an understantement, there were roaches in the room, the response from the staff "we are in Florida" never seen roaches in any hotels in Florida before, the paint on the walls dirty someplaces peeling, the breakfast do not even bother not good quality, old not fresh, the towels were not white were grey from the dirst encrusted, had to buy two towels. Room ery small, the place on the outside it is not very clean either. And we paid over $100.00 a night so NOT WORTH IT. location is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “so so visit”
Reviews.Author: fish1226
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel because of location and price. i chose an ocean front room which was very nice, the room itself was small but it was clean and i supposed i paid for the view. The carpet was soaking wet by the back door balcony from the AC unit leaking which also wasnt in great working order. The tv had a short in it and i asked it be replaced, another came with the same noises, and was told it was due to humidity. Parking is ridiculous on a busy night, take a moped if you want to fit into the many less than compact size spots.The hotel staff was nice and the location and access to beach was great. unfortunately i would suggest that the staff upkeep this place better and take advantage of the great spot of land they have and take care of the appliances more. The hotel looked great online and the loceation is where i wanted to be i would stay again but maybe not for a while....

Reviews.Title: “Room was ok staff was not”
Reviews.Author: BeachMom015
Reviews.Content: Don't expect much from this hotel, If you are just looking for a place to sleep and shower it's ok. Our room was clean, had no problems there. We had a first floor ocean front that was literally just steps from the beach and pool, which was great! The maids I encountered were very rude. I didn't want them servicing our room because I had my laptop and my jewelry in there and the safe was broken...So, I asked one of the maids for just a few clean towels, she handed me one normal towel and 4 hand towels. When I asked her for a 2 more regular towels, another maid yelled at me and said, "no we will give you towels later!" I told her I didn't want my room serviced and I just wanted a few clean towels, she refused to give me towels! We NEVER got clean towels our entire 3 night stay. Also, the "free" breakfast is just about the saddest thing I've ever seen. first of all, it's only available from 6am-9am. So, if you decide to actually relax and sleep in on your vacation you are out of luck and don't bother asking the front desk ladies for a muffin, they too will tell you, "Nah it's already been put up" and this was at 8:45 am. The next morning when I got to the breakfast are earlier all it was, was stale bagels and other stale pastries and instant oatmeal and various juices. Needless to say we never ate breakfast there. The only way I would stay again is if they brushed up on their customer service. I never had any trouble finding a parking space, I suppose if you have a large SUV there would be a problem as the parking spaces are pretty tight. what was really great was the location! It's located on a part of the beach that is NO DRIVE and there are 2 life guards very close, which is great if you have small children. Oh, and the WIFI never worked! I had to actually go to a chick fil that had free WIFI to check my business email. My advice is to pay the extra $30 a night and stay at one of the nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: KekFlorida
Reviews.Content: You'll need a Smart Car to park in the parking lot, there are little black bugs in the pool & a black scum around the edge of the pool, the stucco is falling off the exterior of the buildings. Everyone smokes and leaves butts everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest, most disgusting place we ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: VMUSA1
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place, it is not as advertised!!! We made reservations to stay at this place for 3 nights based on reviews on this website and when we got there, it was the shock of our life. The people at the front desk were friendly and checked us in promptly, but when we got to the room, everything went downhill from there. It was dirty with stains everywhere, the room was supposed to be smoke free but smelled like it had been a previous smoking room, the bed and linens were damp, the AC was spewing black gritty stuff, there was something that looked like dried blood on the sink, and the electronic door locks took several attempts to open. They advertised WiFi, but it didn't work. We were in an upstairs unit and when we went outside on the balcony, the AC cover was lying on the patio floor with all the internals rusty & exposed. We tried to sleep in the room that night and tossed and turned all night long. When we woke up the next morning, we wer all sticky and felt like we were in a sauna. There were big termites running across the bed linens and on the walls and when we looked under the bed, it looked like it hadn't been cleaned for awhile and found cigarette butts. My wife & I had enough and went down to the front desk to check out. There was no way we were going to stay there another night even if they gave us another room. I also called Super 8 corporate to file a complaint which prompted the hotel to call us back to ask us the same questions all over again why we were disatisfied. How many times do you need to tell them that they have a bug infested, dirty, disgusting place and it wasn't as advertised? We ended up staying at the Ramada across from the Speedway - was cheaper and a very nice place place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!, Yucky!! Yuckier!!!, Yuckiest!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachcomber046
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel before and it was okay then so I kept coming back. My last trip however was a total nightmare. I arrived and as usual my room was ready early and Paula (I think) the manager was the best as far as service is concerned but what I found when I went to my room disgusted me. First off, there was a rank, old, smell that refused to be ignored. The carpet showed visible stains, and was so dirty that I did not take my socks off. Then there was a black, coal like substance coming from the ac unit that blew all over the beds. Next, mold and mildew was all over the baseboards and walls, especially in the bathroom area. I checked the beds and there was hair on the sheets. I don't like to make trouble, and I was receiving a pretty decent rate for the room so I decided to try and tough it out for at least one night. Well, when I tried to use the ac unit, it spewed black particles and made a lot of noise. I had to sleep in my clothes on top of the bed because it just wasn't clean. I tried to relax by going down to the beach but everytime I tried to get back in, my key would not work. I must have changed keys 3 times. Finally, I was moved to a new room only to have the same thing happen again, and this room was even dirtier than the last. Management told me that the locks were old and that this is a common occurence. Ok, well, I switched on the tv and it turned itself off, I turned it on again, and it turned itself off. I could not believe my luck. I reported the problem and had another set within an hour. The last day, I accidentally left my key card in the room and informed the desk. They sent a security guard (at least I think he was) who used a key card and guess what? It didnt work. So you know what he did? He just busted the door open and broke the chain lock that was on it. I was very dissapointed with the condition of what used to be a decent hotel. Its run down and needs some serious upgrading if they expect to stay in business.

Reviews.Title: “Steps to Ocean”
Reviews.Author: liquidjas
Reviews.Content: Room was definately old and rundown. It’s alot like the old motels in Wildwood, NJ. However it was directly on the beach in a prime location to Mainstreet and the boardwalk. The Ocean Deck Bar is right next door and a great place to eat and hang out all day long. Parking wasn't the best (small spaces), but they do have an over flow lot down the road. The staff was definately helpful when we needed it. It was definately worth it for the price we paid. This is a good hotel if you don’t plan on staying in the room too much.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: shellfloralcity
Reviews.Content: was there for 4 nites. we had a problem with our a/c not working. they took care of us right away and give us another room. everyone was very nice. housekeepers were friendly. it was in a perfect area. we could walk to everything. will recommend this place to everyone!!! we will be going back to them all the time now

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Bikeweek”
Reviews.Author: BandBAdventures
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay that we could walk to Main Street for Daytona Bikeweek,this location was perfect.We stayed the last weekend of Bikeweek and the first weekend of Spring Break,so yes they had parities everywhere. We had a Oceanfront room,very clean,plenty of room,the bathroom had just been remodled.Only down side parking is tight and we saw NO breakfast or coffee even when their wedsite said free breakfast but it all about LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “on daytona beach you pay for what you get....”
Reviews.Author: ukqt40
Reviews.Content: the pictures online, made this hotel look a great deal nicer...but in reality its an old motel, in need of an update, in an old part of daytona. true, its on the beach, but its also right next door to a night club....that bikers n race fans love to hang out till all hours of the night and morning! we arrived late our first night there, on a saturdy night of a race week.... the people at the front desk couldnt find our reservation, they said we had cancelled it, but via the online site where we booked it, that was impossible to do....so they found us a room, right at the side adjacent to the night club. the room smelt of very strong lysol cleaner. it was old, paper thin walls. but we thought oh well, it was probably one of the cheaper hotels on the whole of daytonna beach. outside there was a lot of noise, race fans checking in...cars reving up loud, bikes screeching. we attempted to sleep at midnight, but the drunks in the rooms either side of us, we determined not to let us. the night club itself wasnt too loud, it was just the people coming and going from it. at 2am the drunks next door hammered loudly on the adjacent doors to wake others up, and then they all decided to go and eat somewhere. they arrived back at 4am, in even worse drunken stupors...so with mad folks yelling and screaming in the road outside, the drunken neighbors, we didnt have a good night sleep...in fact it was quite scarey. we missed breakfast, because we did finally get some sleep around 6am, and slept in a bit! that day we asked to be moved to another room. the staff were very understanding about it all. they moved us to a room right over the other side, upstairs. the thing was though, that night most race folk had gone home, so it was very quiet ! thank god for that, we got a good night sleep. the breakfast was great, and the staff very helpful, they made the best of a bad situation, the motel itself. theres really not much they can do! a lot of the hotels/motels on daytonna beach are old, apart from the new part where the board walk is, so you pay your money, etc....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach- Gloomy room- cheap rates.”
Reviews.Author: TravelSwiss2009
Reviews.Content: This Motel was okay at best. Maybe if you can get a Oceanview room it is better. The room we were given was a "Spring Break" type room. Small, gloomy & no ammenities. There was a small hole in the ceiling above the bathroom sink that dripped water on my head while brushing my teeth. This was a last minute trip so it was a good rate. Laying out at the pool in winter make it well worth it. The hotel location was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat it for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Cuteblankets
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly on the beach with parking at the door (yes, a tight lot but great none the less. We had a room with a full kitchen but unfortunately there were no dishes or pots and pans. The employees are all very nice. Pets are allowed Everything is near by, and simply just a great stop. The room was nice and clean, however the carpet is ready to be replaced. Again, considering that you are directly on the beach and have a full kitchen for $60 I have no right to complain.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: HSMom23
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for two nights after our stay at Disney Resort in Orlando. We wanted to be on right on the beach so I booked an oceanfront room with a full kitchen. Pros: 1. We had room 113. It was a very large room. Kids had a lot of room to run around and play when it rained for a bit in the afternoon. 2. Location, Location, LOCATION! It was right on the beach. I could sit on the patio and watch the kids play. There are also some shops and restaurants nearby. It had a beautiful view. 3. The tub, sink, microwave, oven, and fridge were very clean on the inside. 4. The security/night worker was very nice and helpful. 5. Loved the large picture windows in this room that overlooked the beach. Cons: 1. The lady who checked us in wasn't very friendly. She just handed me my room key, didn't tell me how to get to my room, where to park or anything. I didn't even know about the cont. breakfast until the morning we left. (I guess I am used to that good 'ole Southern Hospitality) 2. There was a strong smell of ammonia in the corridor leading to our room. 3. The room looked fairly clean but had kind of a funky smell. I bought from Glade Odor freshener to spray. That really helped. 4. The outside of the fridge and stove was rusted and nasty looking, but as I said before, the inside was very clean. 5. There were no cooking utensils or silverware in the kitchen. I called the front desk early the next morning to get some. I was told the housekeeping staff came in at 9 and they would send some. I ended up just buying some plastic forks and knives to eat with. I had to call again later in the evening to get some cooking utensils. The gentleman, who I am assuming worked night security, was kind enough to bring some cooking utensils, but there were not any forks, spoons, etc. The pots were small (I was making spaghetti for dinner) and there wasn't a cookie sheet to bake in the oven. 6. The parking lot is very small. It is hard to maneuver a van or large SUV. 7. The pool was very nice, but the section that was supposed to be 3ft was almost up to my neck. My 5yo couldn't swim in the pool. I don't know if it was just over filled, or what. Overall, for the price, we were very pleased. Great for the two nights we stayed. It allowed us to just veg on the beach after our busy week at Disney and allowed us to rest up before our long trip home to TN. Next time I would bring my own cookie sheet and cooking utensils, just to be sure. If you are expecting a 5 star hotel, then I would avoid this place. If you are looking for someplace reasonably priced and close to the beach and with in walking distance to shops and restaurants, then this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recomment staying here! No No No”
Reviews.Author: madigraced1
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again nicer hotels were only $10 more well worth the $10 bucks to stay somewhere else. We had nothing but problems from the get go we checked in immediately but our family memeber ended up waiting almost an hour for there room to "be ready". The rooms were not clean nothing like the pics. Yes I do know its the Super 8 but its still almost as expensive as other places so come on give me a break. The staff had a problem giving us 4 more extra towels. WARNING to all people who go on vacation with there children this place is not safe such as no batteries, none working smoke dectors i know this for a fact. "Security" for the hotel if u can call it that is rude and watches young girls swimming at the pool "creepy" we ended up leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for spring break, anything else find something else!”
Reviews.Author: jbabie018
Reviews.Content: Great deal, but once we walked in we realized why. Staff at desk was also the cleaning staff & not very friendly. Room smelled horrible, like a musky smell to it. Our door did not close right, to close it all the way you had to lift it up and pull in. Staff didnt clean our room, change our garbage or give us new toilet paper for 2 days. We had to go down and ask for everything to be done. Great place to stay if you arent going to be in the room much like we were. Its right on the beach and walking distance to shops and bars. So spring break this hotel would be a good idea, family trip I would say no!

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Oceanfront was great”
Reviews.Author: evilflowers
Reviews.Content: Before selecting this hotel we read several reviews to help us make our decision. The hotel was what we expected based on these other reviews. Our room was clean and modern. The staff was pleasant at all times and willing to help us find some local dining when we requested. We had a courtyard room but were able to see the ocean with a clear view of the pool also. The pool is right next to the beach with easy beach access. It looked to me that almost every room had a view of the ocean except for select few rooms. There was a bar/restaurant next door a Wendy's and a convinience store within very close walking distance. The hotel was in a great location and only about a block and a half from the boardwalk. Come the weekend the hotel filled with vacationers and parking became a real issue. Parking was already difficult with the SUV we rented due to the small lot, but once the weekend came we were lucky to have a spot at all. We did not leave the hotel in the car, because we were afraid we might lose our spot. We brought our concerns to managments attention. Other than parking this hotel helped to make a wonderful vacation for me and my boyfriend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Party Place”
Reviews.Author: kklucy
Reviews.Content: Ok - this is one of those places " you get what you pay for" we had a great room ( 213) with a great view - it is not a 4 diamond place and you should not expect that - we went over father's day weekend, which as a group we have done every year for sometime now - we book a bunch of rooms and camp out on the grass all day - enjoy the pool and beach - Our room was clean- and bright - the kitchen supplies were not over the top - but we did not use them -A bigger coffee maker would be nice but not a big deal as they serve coffee down by the office - breakfast is not over the top- but hey - it's free and there are LOTS of choices nearby The parking is the most difficult part of our stay - we get there, park our car and don't move it - parking is a premium - Also, we could here someone snoring in the room next to us - Again, the price is right for our group of friends that hit this spot every year -

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very casual the entire staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: nsmonkey67
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from June 11-15 2008 and it was my 4th stay at this location. I make the calls directly to them due to being there the last 4 years. The staff is courtious and friendly and they are quick to assist with any issue I had. I will be back next year for my yearly girls weekend! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Make Due On A Budget”
Reviews.Author: ktp711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used it only for sleeping. I had called in advance AND had rechecked the day before "check in" to make sure we had a room on the second floor and was told that we did...and was given room #204. But upon arrival, we were told that room was already given out and that there were no other available rooms on the second floor unless we wanted a smoking room. Which I can not do because it makes sleeping difficult for me....so instead we got the nasty room...the one with the stained carpet that was slightly damp...probably due to the a/c unit that didn't drain outside but rather inside the room. So yea, the room was musty and slightly funky in smell. We had to buy an air freshener to help counter the funky smell. Use Oust disinfectant if you ever get stuck with a room like ours it helped elevate the smell a bit....not all...but at least some. The clerk didn't seem interested whether we wanted to stay or not, he was too busy answering his cell phone to care one way or another. But since we were already there and the price was okay and we weren't really going to be in the room much it didn't really matter too much to my husband either. So I held my tongue and beared it. The cleaning lady was nice though but the breakfast lady was not. I tried getting breakfast but the lady locked the door 7-10 minutes before 9 am so people wouldn't come in and if you didn't go to the front desk (like me) to inquire about it it would stay locked....and that was the first 2 days we were there. On our last day there was a different girl who was in charge and SHE at least did NOT lock the door until 9 am. Overall, it was an okay stay since all we used it for was to have a place to sleep and it was right by the beach. The other cool thing about it was that it was right next to Ocean Deck. One other thing, since it's so close to a bar/restaurant be prepare for some rowdy disturbances late night. Our second night there had some kind of commotion that had the police on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Kitty65
Reviews.Content: Pros: Right on a very nice beach. Close to shopping, food, etc. Cons: Room was dirty Most of the staff was rude I think for the money, there are many other places right near there that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Even Get to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aeducky23
Reviews.Content: So we called the motel in February 2008 to make reservations for our trip in MAY 2008. We specified that we wanted FIRST FLOOR, kitchen. We called 2 different times to CONFIRM that we had FIRST FLOOR WITH KITCHEN. After driving 16 hours from Ohio, we arrived at the Super 8. They told us that they only had SECOND FLOOR kitchen available, and that the guest has a prefrence but will not always get it. When we called the 2 times to confirm, they guaranteed that we would get exactly what we wanted. The room on the second floor had a smashed cockroach on the wall, and was TINY! The stove is basically on top of the bed. It was VERY dirty and run down. When we told the front desk that we did not want our room because we were guaranteed the first floor, she tried keeping $50 of our deposit for cancellation fee? But it wasn't our fault that they screwed up. They finally gave it to us. We checked out the Mayan Inn-JUST AS BAD! We finally ended up at Best Western Auku Tiki-Inn-what a wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “oh gad! what a terrible hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sunworshiper7153
Reviews.Content: apparently this hotel was "recently" renovated? hmmm - the pool maybe!!??!! Saw there were painted-over spiders tho! The rooms stink! stank! stunk! We had to go to the convenient store down the street to buy febreeze so we could tolorate the room. The security locks on the doors are still chains, but no nobbies on the end of the chains, so you cannot secure the doors. Oh, and by the way - cockroach city!! We never had a linen change in the 5 days we were there, we had to ask for sheets, blankets and pillows for the hideabed the first night (even though they knew there were more than two booked in the room) the hideabed mattress was stinky, old and broken down. The bedspreads in other rooms were stained :( We had to ask for lightbulbs to be installed, had to ask for clean towels as they just hung up the ones we left on the floor in the morning! the drain for the main sink was broken, there were people that slept over night on the grassy area. there was however "one" very nice security man that was diligent in doing rounds. There is a very loud nightclub next door that shuts down at 4am, so lots of noise. the meeting room and conference room are one in the same...the breakfast was okay (oranges - very tasty!) the coffee maker in the room only makes one cup of coffee at a time. Overall, we would never return nor would we ever recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 Oceanfront Delivers”
Reviews.Author: sbulldog53
Reviews.Content: Paula and the other hotel staff were great! Annie in housekeeping was super nice. They worked out any issues we encountered. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beach front Location!”
Reviews.Author: flexonguy
Reviews.Content: Great location....rooms are average and nothing special. The staff were very friendy. Did not get a chance to use the pool or beach...stayed there on the coldest day of the year! O.K breafast...nothing special....

Reviews.Title: “A Little Effort Goes A Long Way!”
Reviews.Author: pahhobbs
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay here for New Year's Eve with a trip rewards points room. Last year we got an oceanfront king and this year we were lucky to get a parking lot room with 2 doubles. I did call to confirm, always a good idea at this model, and was assured the room was a king although they did no longer redeem Trip Rewards points for oceanfront rooms. The room we first got wouldn't open with the key. A staff member tried to open it and then we had to go back to the desk for another room. The 2nd room had 2 doubles so another trip back to the office was when we were informed that they do not redeem Trip Reward points for king beds. UGH! Very aggravating. The room was a decent size, but the furniture is pure junk! The mattresses were comfortable I will say that. The light fixture was hanging off the wall, but the bathroom was reasonably clean. Towels were just awful with stains and see through. We discovered there was no regular coffee only decaf. Upon visiting the office (we were now regulars!) we were informed they don't do regular coffee anymore! Coffee makers in the room but only decaf. I don't drink the stuff, but how ridiculous. My husband was not happy. They told him he was welcomed to get coffee at the front desk anytime. After the 2nd cup he realized that was decaf too. If you read the first line you'll see that I said this was our 2nd stay here. Last year we had the oceanfront and that made up for a lot. I won't stay here again. We go for the NY Eve party on Main Street and it is an easy walk for a very fun night. I'll spend the extra money for the Hilton I guess. The Mayan is just as bad and the reviews here for the Saxony make the Super 8 sound like a luxury hotel. It is a shame that we cannot have decent rooms for a decent price in Daytona Beach. I've been defending my home for a long time, and I'm embarrassed to say that all I have heard from our visitors is true!

Reviews.Title: “everything wet”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: It rained the whole 3 days we were there, The windows leaked water all over the place I had my clothes laid out in the chair next to the dinner table and everything was all wet it came right threw the sliding glass doors. the air condioner was soaked I was afraid to touch it. hopefully the will fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-performance ratio”
Reviews.Author: Philipp_G
Reviews.Content: It’s a motel, so you can’t expect luxury. But the room was clean. All appliances in the room were working. The room had a nice balcony with beach view at this beach front motel. You can literally jump from the balcony onto the beach. The pool is nice and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. There were no parking hassles. There was enough parking space and I was able to park directly in front of my room. But I must admit there were only a few other guests at the time I stayed. Only the breakfast was a bit wimpy without a large choice.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We were coming back from three crazy, hectic days in Orlando at the Disney parks and just wanted a place to relax. We had stayed at Super 8 motels before, so we weren't expecting the Ritz-Carlton. We arrived at the motel early--just before 12:00. We asked the friendly lady at the desk if we could park our car there, even though it was before check-in time. She said she'd just check us in and let us have our room, since it was ready. Upon arriving at the room, we couldn't open the door. We kept trying the key card, but weren't successful. A maid came running to our rescue and helped us open the door. We continued having problems with the door, so we reported it to the front desk. The man at the front desk immediately sent someone over to change the entire lock mechanism. We were then able to get in without problems. Upon going to bed that night, we noticed that the air-conditioner made a scraping sound each time it came on and went off. We reported that, too, and somebody promptly came over and fixed it. The pool went out of service, so they sent people to the Best Western next door. My feeling is that if you're just looking for a place to sleep, this is fine. It was reasonably clean, and the staff was great. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who is looking for a vacation with a really nice place in mind, since this is clearly a budget motel. We really loved the location, which was next door to the Ocean Deck Restaurant. We ate there twice, and it's a fun place to eat. You can just walk up from the beach and sit on their deck with your bathing suit on and order from the menu. In addition, it's close to the action--the arcades and attractions and shopping. We might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beachfront access and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Pettraveler_7
Reviews.Content: My family and I (dog included) simply loved this place. From our arrival the staff was kind, courteous and and very friendly. We arrived a few hours early and although the service was still turning over the rooms, the front desk let us have a parking pass, gave us water and small bowl for our dog. We had reserved an ocean front room and that is exactly what we were given when we arrived. Second floor overlooking the beautiful ocean. Clean room, prompt maid service every day we were there. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone with a small pet or if you are traveling on a budget. I wish I could get back sooner. Everything was in walking distance too! The mall, Bubba Gump Shrimp, Movies. Great experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “yes they had a room”
Reviews.Author: bazar1970
Reviews.Content: we had just arrived in daytona and went to a hotel that i had booked online and arrived to see that it was not like it was advertised. we rushed into the car and headed back to the super 8 which we had stayed last year. luckily they had aroom and it was great . they even kept the same rate for all 3 days.the room was ocean front and on the corner full size frig ,sink and stove. thanks for the room it made a bad situation better . love the ocean deck ate there twice .we will only stay there when visting daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bulldawg956
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Myself and my Father-In-Law have stayed at the Super 8 Ocean front for the last three years and plan on staying there again in Aug/Sept time frame. You could not ask for a better place to stay on the beach for the price. We have never had any problems with anyone there. The staff has always been polite and helpfull. We stayed there one year and had a problem with the air conditioner the manager moved us from a standard room to a ocean front room without any additional charge. You are not getting a big fancy room with gold trim and if that is what you want you need to look else where. If you want a nice clean room at a decent price then there is no other place on the beach that compares to this one for the money. The Ocean Deck is right next door and it is a small walk to the Board walk and the Pier. Parking on the weekend can be a little trouble but never had any bad problems. We are looking foward to our stay this year as we have the last three years. I will not even consider another hotel as long as this one stays the way it is. Clean, decent priced and a staff that is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “New Management!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Daytona Inn for 20+ years, but that place simply goes down in class yearly and the number of fights in the parking lot due to the bar off the lobby during my visits have increased. I did a "pot luck" stroll up the street and discovered this little Super 8 gem. I passsed it up many many times thinking, well....it was a Super 8 and it didn't look real nice. It was obviously cleaner this time. I stayed there this time and now have a dedicated destination for this area. It was clean, staff was very friendly, they cater to good customers....fun-loving but not to the extreme where it interferes with the other customers, family-oriented, safe courteous atmosphere. I am serious folks, this place deserves your attention. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. It is my understanding that this hotel is under new management and thus, the improved atmosphere. I am returning next week and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “busy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: called to reserve a room this is after learning that almost every place is sold out and the guy answers and says I have a room but im to busy to reserve it right now. After I had been looking almost 12 hrs on the internet. So I called customer service and they cut me a deal because I was treated bad and reserved a room there for me and when I called to make sure everything was set the same guy would not honor the deal that super 8 customer service gave me this place has terrible custmer appreciation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for just sleepin it off”
Reviews.Author: hollyann22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at thte Super 8 oceanfront last year on our yearly trip down to Daytona Beach. We used the room as a cheap close place to stay near the nightlife so we could walk everywhere. For the price and our purpose we couldn't beat it. We got a coupon out of the Florida Tourist Guide for 43.95 a night! We requested a smoking room and boy did we get it! The fridge (for which we were very thankful for!) had obviously been used as an ashtray on several occasions but the inside was clean and smelled of bleach. The room was nothing special and the pool was extreamly small. But then again we didn't really care about that stuff. The best part about the whole stay were the great places we went to that night! Two places you really must hang out at are the Ocean Deck wich is right next door to the Super 8 (very short stumble back to the room!) They feature live reggaaee music and beach volleyball! Very Happenin Place! Another place you must walk on down the beach to is the Mai Tai Bar. This place truely has the best happy hour and friendly staff! We spend 5 out of 7 nights down at the Mai Tai! You just can't beat it. It is rated the number 1 singles attraction in Daytona Beach. But just be careful. Too many mai tais can make for a very long walk back down the beach to the Super 8!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Super 8 to visit family over the holidays. Our reservation was made for 2 double beds on the side of the hotel, but we wondered if we could upgrade to a king bed on the ocean. The girl was hesitant at first, but her manager heard us talking and came out right away to tell us we could. We were so thankful. We live in Kansas and don't get down to the beach very often. Our room was lovely and the staff was so accomodating. I have read all of these reviews and cannot see where they are coming from. The parking area is slightly lacking, but it didn't seem like a major problem. Overall, for the price, I would say this hotel is a wonderful value and good qaulity for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: DKHESE
Reviews.Content: The place isn't fancy, but your not paying for a luxury hotel. What it is, is a clean place with a great location! Right on the beach a couple hundred feet down from the Main pier and Boardwalk. Right next door is the Ocean Deck reggae bar which has decent food and good live entertainment. We did have a problem with our door lock, but even on a Saturday evening the hotel had someone in to fix it right away. If I'm just looking for a basic room for a good price, I'd stay hear again in a heartbeat!!! The employees were very nice and accomidating.

HotelInfo.Name: Roomba Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 133 South Ocean Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
